intro: Hibbertia avonensis, commonly known as the Avon sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces yellow flowers with five petals, often arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, ovate leaves. Hibbertia avonensis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal regions.
